author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In Temasek's court the bards do tell,
Of global tremors, men know well.
The pace of gold to moderate,
For earth's vast riches tremble late.

The oil springs in the Chinese land,
Do dance anew at the sovereign's hand.
The hopes of many soar sublime,
Upon the wings of Eastern clime.

In London's heart the metals lie,
As China's promise paints the sky.
A feeble dollar in the twilight cast,
Beneath the East, its shadow vast.

feedItems.title: Temasek to Moderate Investment Pace as Global Economy Remains Fragile
feedItems.description: Singapore’s Temasek Holdings said intensifying geopolitical tensions are among the main contributing factors for slowing global growth.

feedItems.title: Oil Gains on Hopes for Chinese Stimulus
feedItems.description: Oil prices ticked higher in Europe, buoyed by hopes that China will provide more support to its property sector.

feedItems.title: Metals Prices Rise Amid China Property Support, Weaker Dollar
feedItems.description: Metals pushed upwards in early London trade, with reports of further support measures for China’s property sector propping up prices, while a weaker dollar provided a tailwind.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
From the land of timbered halls, the German yield,
Reflects the ECB’s destined shield.
Schatz weaves its subtle spell, says Natixis,
In market's thunder, it bears no tricks.

Beneath the sky's ever-changing canvas,
Dollar, battle-weary, does adjust.
Against the Euro, it lost its discourse,
ING pronounces, 'tis the rightful course.

The British Isles, the sea's tune they sing,
Echo with pleasantries of wage growth's spring.
Though the drake of unemployment takes flight,
At 4%, it remains a glimmer in the night.

feedItems.title: German 2Y Bond Yields Seen in Sync With Markets' ECB Rate Expectations
feedItems.description: Two-year German Schatz yields correctly reflect market expectations for the ECB’s policy rates, Natixis said.

feedItems.title: Dollar Falls on Prospect of US Interest-Rate Outlook Diverging From Others
feedItems.description: The dollar fell to a two-month low against the euro and a basket of currencies as U.S. interest rates look likely to rise less than rates in other countries, ING said.

feedItems.title: UK Wage Growth Tops Forecasts as Jobless Rate Rises
feedItems.description: UPDATED: The U.K.’s average weekly earnings, excluding bonuses, remained at 7.3% in the three months to May, while the unemployment rate rose to 4%.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Upon the narrowing swift and fast,
Of BTP-Bund spread that hath passed,
A tipple to Mizuho, be it raised,
A correction he perceived, hath him amazed.

Daimler’s truck, on strength doth ride,
Their forecast increases, with pride, 
In August shall they wealth buy back,
God grant them a blessed fiscal track. 

Look yonder, German inflation doth mount,
Rate doth rise to what experts count,
From June it leapt, 'tis no jest,
In God's grace, may they fare the best.

feedItems.title: Ten-Year BTP-Bund Yield Spread Seen in 175-180 Basis Point Range in 3Q
feedItems.description: The narrowing of the 10-year Italian BTP-German Bund spread in June happened too fast and some correction was to be expected, Mizuho said, expecting it to trade around 175-180 bps through the third quarter.

feedItems.title: Daimler Truck Lifts Guidance on Core Market Strength
feedItems.description: Daimler Truck increased its forecasts for industrial business revenue to €54 billion-€56 billion and its adjusted return on sales to 8.5%-10%, and said it would start a buyback of up to €2 billion in August.

feedItems.title: German Inflation Rebounds as Expected
feedItems.description: Germany’s CPI increased 6.4% in June, confirming preliminary estimates, with the core inflation rate rising to 5.8% from 5.4% in the prior month.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Upon Nikkei's field, a goat doth stray,
Through stocks of silicon and iron's mire.
His gain doth cover banker's and craftsmen's dismay,
In balance, at day's end, their plight no dire.

The dignified hound seeks time to run,
Through a maze of charges, he needs to pace.
Indictment's snail trail, under the court's sun,
Calls for a moment to review his trace.

Chinese hares once leapt with fervor and clout,
Drew the eye of the great global owl in flight.
Yet their euphoria did tattle, now no shout,
Shadows grow long as others take the light.

feedItems.title: Nikkei Ends Flat, Helped by Electronics, Mining Stocks
feedItems.description: The Nikkei Stock Average closed flat at 32203.57 as gains in electronics and mining stocks helped offset losses in banks and automakers.

feedItems.title: Donald Trump Asks Court to Delay Trial in Classified-Documents Case
feedItems.description: The former president’s legal team said it wants time to review the inquiry that led to his indictment.

feedItems.title: For Chinese Stocks, the 'Euphoria Fizzled Out'---Now Other Asian Markets Are Booming
feedItems.description: China was once the most attractive stock market in the region for global investors, but many have turned their attention elsewhere.
